reviews.review: This is nothing less than a thinking man's (or woman's) game. If you're not into getting that nagging "thinking" feeling, don't even bother with this!

Me volvi un 15% mas inteligente despues de jugar a esta maravilla de los videojuegos... Es extraordinariamente original y divertido. Trabaja tu mente de tal manera que te ayuda a prestar atencion al espacio que te rodea y por eso es tambien un juego unico. 
Muchos se quejan de la corta duracion pero yo creo que esta bastante bien. Hay que tener en cuenta que es un juego de naturaleza repetitiva, la mayor parte del juego se basa en ir de nivel en nivel resolviendo los puzzles, un juego muy largo terminaria por aburrir a la mayoria y que abandonen el juego en la mitad.
play this befor u play portal three it is quite fun withthe portals

Portal is the 1st of 2 epic puzzle games. By the creators of half life, counter-strike and team fortress 2 comes an epic adventure puzzler. I love this game and it challenges your mind to epic courses of fun and trouble.
One of the best games I've played recently.
Someone told me there would be cake...

One of the best puzzle games I've ever played. I've beaten it multiple times through and, despite its very short campaign, I still enjoy it and it's few extras. Even after playing the second I still come back to the original from time to time. If you like puzzle games this is definitely one to add to your collection.

The primary reason I finally got Steam was so that I could play the game that all my friends had been telling me to play for years: Portal. I had hyped the game up in my head due to all the positive things I had heard about it. Having played the game today, it definitely lived up to all the hype. The levels were so much fun and the puzzles got increasingly challenging as I went. I already can't wait to replay it, and to play the sequel game. At this point I doubt there are many people out there who haven't already played Portal, but if I find any I will definitely recommend this great game. Cheers!

Fantastic game! It has a simple premise yet it often presents you with a seemingly impossible puzzle, what a blast when you figure out how to complete it.

I played Portal 2 before this one, but it still was amazing to play, but short. I beat the game in 1.5 hours, and Portal 2 in about 5.
Still the best puzzel game though.

The story is shorter than the sequel, but gameplay is pretty much the same.
I suggest you buy both Portal 2 and Portal like I did.
Trust me. It's worth it.

First, I have to tell you something. If you have played Portal 2 before this (like me). Go, run and buy this masterpiece! This game is the origin of one of my favorite games (Portal 2). What can I say about this? Well, the game is very very short, but is still awesome! Have extra challenge maps and more extra fun which will blow your mind. Is very funny try to get all the archievements. And remember something...the cake is a lie!
FANTASSSSSSSSSSSSTIC game of puzzles with portals. Extra hard challenges wiht this classic, old-skool kinda game! Overl fantastic
Definiately good for those who like to problem solve.
I recomend it.  Portal is a game for players 18+. With strong language, blood, and skill, this is an AWESOME GAME.
So simple and yet so brilliant !

Portal to przede wszystkim świetnie zaprojektowane poziomy, pod względem rozgrywki jak i treści. Pod względem rozgrywki dają dobre wyzwanie ale nie wnerwiają. Pod względem treści są zgodne ze światem rozgrywki a głównie w póżniejszej części są elementem narracji (są też dość tajemnicze). I to jest naprawdę dobrę. Dobre są też mechaniki, dość prosto ogarnąć zasady lecz nie są prostackie. Fabuła też jest donra choć nie bardzo rozbudowana. Graficznie nie jest żle, lecz menu jest trochę... e... ubogie? Nie jest to jednak coś co psuje grę. Troche dziwne są wczytywania gry, normalne jak i po zgonach. Ogółem to bardzo dobra gra choć wolę drugą część ale to może też dlatego że w Portal 2 grałem wcześniej.
Best puzzle game ever
The cake is a lie. 10/10
Everyone who likes video games needs to play Portal.

It's a classic. Read any review of this game and it's easy to see why. Valve added personality and soul to what could have been just another puzzle game. Indeed, it is the spirit of GLADoS that makes the game so damned enjoyable.

A Valve mais uma vez criou um excelente jogo, Portal que também está no universo de Half Life(outro grande sucesso da produtora) traz um cenário de total isolamento, até por que você não encontra uma alma viva além de você em toda a trajetória da personagem. Ao logo de todo o game uma IA te dá ordens e basicamente você segue elas, e usando sua arma de criar portais é possível resolver todos os enigmas de cada cenário. Ótimo jogo, pena que é curto, mas claramente tem muita coisa nele que vai te prender e com certeza te deixará fascinado. A Engine é a famosa Source, que tem uma qualidade muito boa, então os gráficos se assemelham muito com Half Life 2 e Episodes 1 e 2. A única coisa que faz falta nele é um Multiplayer, coisa que seu sucessor corrigiu, mas mesmo assim vale a pena jogá-lo.

The Portal series is an amazingly game. The gameplay experience is literally like riding a roller coaster, it leaves you with a little mushy feeling in the brain which is strangely satisfying. You really have to try it out to experience that strange feeling for yourself. 

The only qualm I have with Portal 1 is that the game seemed a litttle short. It felt like just a demo, a demo for something that's stupidly good, but still a demo. Portal 2 has a much more satisfying plot with the same amazing gameplay and is undoubtedly the better game imo. However, Portal 2's plot continues from Portal 1 and for me, that fact would still make Portal 1 a worthy buy despite its short length.
This is one of the most entertaining games I have played. 10/10

A fun game where you have to think about actions. I really enjoyed playing this game, especially the end.
I recommend this game to all my friends :D
Es un juegazo! Dura apenas 2-3 horas pero es imprescindible, muy entretenido y divertido y te hará pensar para superar todos los desafios.

Portal is a great entry into Portal 2 as it will introduce you to all the inside jokes in the series. It is also great if you already have Portal 2 but is not necessary. The only downside is that if you are good at solving puzzles the game may take only 2-3 hours to complete.

Ich habe dieses Spiel erst sehr spät gespielt. Habe auch mit dem zweiten Teil angefangen, und jetzt den ersten nachgeholt.
Ist ganz nett. Aber für die 2 Stunden Spielzeit für die Story empfehle ich allen die es nicht kennen direkt Portal 2. Ist wesentlich länger, kniffliger und auch von den Charakteren ausgebauter.

This is one of the best games I've ever played and would recommend to all gamers alike. While short, it's one of those games with a lot of atmosphere and "lore" behind it all which could be an attraction for some. The ending is definitely one of the more exciting bits and the entire game will have you thinking. I'd highly recommend this to anyone,

Well first of all who doesnt just love doing science! tons of fun and a great look back into one of the best games ever made. A fantastic story and tons of fun to be had on the exteras. Although they are extreamly hard and time consuming I find myself going for some of the harder challenges for hours on hours.
I fell in love with this game. I highly recommend!
10/10 So much fun but seemed short; glad Portel 2 exists!

Excellent game, I recommend it to everybody.

With its captivating atmosphere and brilliant puzzle-solving mechanics, Portal is easily one of the best Sci-Fi video games out there. You play as Chell, a lone test subject trapped in a testing facility, guided only by an animatronic voice which forces her to do pointless tests for the sake of it. Completing these experiments while Chell finishes test chamber after test chamber is the main premise of the game, and its atmosphere fits it perfectly. Its squeaky-clean initial image and lonely feeling testifies that something is not quite right in this place...
10/10

Portal ist ein "kurzes"(2Std) spiel was schon ein bisschen Gehirn beansprucht dennoch sind manche späteren Aufgaben wie der Boss ein wenig zu einfach geraten. Die Grafik ist "akzeptabel". Die Spielidee GENIAL. Geschichte TOP. Fazit ein Spiel mit einer "perfekten" und einzigartigen Spielidee wo man ruhig mal 10€ ausgeben kann! Negativ: -Der Boss Kampf | Positiv : - Der Rest

너무 사고 싶어서 인내심의 벽을 넘지 못하고

정가구매를 하는 미친짓을 저지르긴 했으나 (눙물이 난다)

정말 재밌게 즐긴 게임이고, 최초로 엔딩을 본 게임이다.

원작이라고 할 수 있는 나바큘라 드롭의 쌍팔년도 스타일 그래픽과

게다가 최적화는 덤이여.

Muy recomendado.

Innovador como pocos. Un shooter en primera persona "sin enemigos directos".

Aquí no se trata de ser el más rápido, si no el más inteligente y pensar posibles soluciones para un mismo problema. Aunque los gráficos no son de lo mejor, no decepcionan a nadie. Con tonos tanto claros como oscuros, se pueden apreciar los suficientes detalles como para no depender de los gráficos a la hora de pasarte el juego. Tiene un sistema de juego bástante fácil, a mi parecer. Es bastante cómodo a la hora de abrir portales y realizar acciones. 

Como contra, diría que es bastante corto, en unas 3 o 4 horas te lo puedes pasar tranquilamente, pero como pro, me encantó la historia y la lucha entre la inteligencia humana y la artificial del juego (GLaDOS es una antagonista a la que se le coje cariño por su forma de actuar y sus controversias a la hora de comunicarse con la protagonista, aunque quiera matarte).

Si buscas un juego que varíe la rutina y te haga pensar en vez de reaccionar, este es tu juego, un juego que no te enamorará por su duración ni dificultad, pero si por su esencia.
Dość ciekawa gra, nakłania do myślenia. Polecam.
传送门目前只穿过一次，但是内容很有趣，值得一买
Great puzzle game

Ottimo gioco di puzzle!
Sarai impegnato/a infatti nella risoluzione di enigmi ambientali con l'ausilio di una speciale pistola in grado di creare portali dimensionali intercomunicanti. L'obiettivo è quello di progredire da una stanza all'altra di un misterioso labirinto, guidati da una intelligenza artificiale non priva di uno humour un po' macabro.
Il concept è semplice, ma efficacie, e dopo aver appreso le basi nei primi livelli, cimentarsi nell'avanzamento del labirinto sarà sempre più stimolante e divertente. 
Non sono un appassionato di rompicapo, pur avendo dimistichezza con puzzle ambientali a là Zelda, ma non posso dire di essermi trovato in enormi difficoltà. Ho completato le 19 mappe principali in 5 ore, di cui però, è bene dirlo, la metà spesa per le ultime 4 mappe - segno che la difficoltà cresce gradualmente man mano che ci si sposta verso il centro del labirinto. 
Ho avuto molta più difficoltà con le mappe avanzate, nient'altro che sei delle mappe precedenti rese molto più ostiche ( la 15 e la 18 mi hanno fatto smadonnare...).
Lo stile grafico è scarno, ma tutto sommato piacevole, si adatta bene al contesto. L'audio idem. 
Sono riuscito a trovare solo due difetti significativi:
1) breve durata, anche se in realtà dipende molto dalle vostra abilità logiche e dalla voglia di cimentarsi; potreste finirlo in due ore, come in venti...
2) sistema di controllo indeciso, infatti a volte fila tutto liscio, mentre in altre bisogna ritentare più volte solo per una corretta esecuzione, pur avendo compreso la logica del puzzle (questo si sente moltissimo nelle mappe avanzate...)
Conclusioni: 
se amate unire videogiochi e sfide logico-spaziali, prendetelo in fretta, anche perché ormai costa una miseria. Se invece detestate il genere, evitatelo, perché in tal caso rischiate un calo di autostima intellettuale non da poco.
Este es un gran juego que recomiendo a todos los amantes de los rompecabezas y aun cuando no dure mucho, si vale la pena comprarlo.
EPICAMENTE EPICO, DE DIFICULTAD ELEVADA, SIN TONTERIAS, UN JUEGO PARA QUE DES UN RATO A LA CABEZA, Y APRENDAS A LA VEZ QUE JUEGAS, SIMPLEMENTE, INCREIBLE

Portal is probably my pick for the best game ever. It's just perfect. The learning curve is consistent, since it won't really put the player in any state of real danger, and lets them have space to figure out how to progress through the game. I have heard many players whine about games nowadays having too many tutorials, and i can relate to those people. Holding the players hand all the fucking time will NOT get them excited to play the game, especially if you are pumping the player too much information on one go. But Portal, i can say 3/4 of the game is a tutorial. While it is REALLY SUBTLE, the different mechanics are delivered to the player one at a time, and are reminded of during the following test chambers. The challenge ramps up all the time, but just enough so that the player won't feel overwhelmed. Although the game is extremely linear, it doesn't hurt the experience. The atmosphere is also brilliant. The solid and pure parts of the test chambers don't give the player anything to get distracted, and the ambient music accompanying the levels also delivers the feeling that you ARE in a testing facility. The ladder parts of the game are also brilliant, keeping the player interested with showing the player what's going on "behind the scenes" of Aperture. There may be some parts that may leave you just pondering and pondering the puzzles, but those are few and far away and can be solved pretty quickly by just thinking outside the box. GlaDOS is the one of my favorite antagonists in video games, probably next to Vaas Montenegro from Far Cry 3. As a character, she was interesting. Who was she? Why did she choose me to do this puzzles? Why is it that she seems to angrier and angrier all through the game? Playing the game through a second time made me realize how subtle she was in delivering some negative and hateful comments towards me, but she was also much more than just a really angry AI. Plus Ellen McClain is a really great voice actor. While the game was really short, since you can beat it in about 2 or 3 hours, the game still left me feeling satisfied with the experience and hungry for more. Even though this game has gotten the praise it deserves and even more, i still can't stop loving it! Almost every single one of us have a game that we love so much, that they can always play it. No matter what time or what season of the year it is, they still can. Mine would absolutely be Portal. It's a game i can just launch on Steam and play through in a single run over and over and over and over again, but i still feel this warmth  inside me whenever i play it. It's that great. ﻿

10/10

Juego de puzles tremendamente original y todo un reto.Consiste en llegar de un punto A a un punto B utilizando para ello portales espaciales que tú mismo vas creando.El juego en algunas fases puede resultar frustante sin embargo tampoco es un juego tremendamente difícil.Con dedicación y razonamiento se terminan sacando los puzles.Contínuamente en el juego te habla una voz con un toque de humor que ameniza cada partida.El juego no es muy largo pero suficiente para saborear un buen juego de rompecabezas.Totalmente recomendado.

Un jeu cour et c'est une force ! 
Le level design est agréable et juste, participant activement à la narration.
Le Game design est très solide, l'expérience de jeu est amusante, fluide et immersive, les récompenses sont nombreuses.
Les seuls points imparfaits du titre seraient un background narratif qui aurait pu être plus approfondie et des puzzles plus complexes et variées. Seulement le titre est conci et ne laisse presque pas de place à la répétitivité et aucune à l'ennui.

Rien ne m'a empèché de profiter de ce titre a 100% qui mérite amplement sa dénomination de "classique".

*Chicken-Rank : 10/10

Portal is an enticing experience for the brain, offering challenging puzzles at every turn. And while an expansive story may not make itself apparent in the midst of these trials, a dark humor punctuates the "Dialog" (for lack of better words) and breathes a bit of fresh life into the game making for a few laughs. Overall, I'd say Portal is a classic, and a game that everyone should try at least once in their lifetime.

Portal is a puzzle game released by Valve in late 2007 along with The Orange Box, it was intended to be something of a stocking stuffer as an apology for there not being a Half-Life 2: Episode 3. It wound up becoming the most successful game of the lot.

The game was developed by a small team whom Gabe Newell imediately hired after seeing their previous work "Narbacular Drop", The precursor to Portal.

Spoiling as little as possible: You are a woman named Chell who has awoken from what can only be assumed is a cryosleep in the Aperture Science Enrichment Centre. You are greeted by a voice called GLaDOS or "Genetic Lifeform and Disc Operating System" who tells you that you're about to take part in a serious of tests involving the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device. (Or just the Portal Gun.)

The gameplay is simple. You guide Chell through a series of puzzles contained within the game's 19 test chambers with naturally progressing difficulty, though, the difficulty of the game as a whole isn't that bad, the puzzles aren't mind boggling and the closest thing you'll come to common enemies are these adorable white spherical turrets. The game runs on the Source Engine and it's acurate physics simulations. This is shown off in many of the game's mechanics most notably momentum based puzzles which like the rest of the game is sound. The game is quite easy once you know the solutions to the puzzles, beatable in just three hours on the first playthrough and if you're like me can be beaten in as little as 35 minutes when you decide to try and speedrun it. (or even less if you're persistent enough, I've seen people do it in as little as 9 minutes.) Don't worry about that first playthrough though, as you'll miss out on the game's fantastic writing and pacing if you do. Ellen McLain gives a brilliant performance as GLaDOS with well crafted dark humour anybody can enjoy.

SPOILER TERRITORY AHEAD
After all is said and done and you reach the end of Chamber 19 you're sent into an incinerator. Most of GLaDOS' dialogue up to this point sounded as though it could have been pre-recorded but it now becomes aparant she's been watching you the whole time and is aware of your escape after you... do that. You make your way through the less sterile maintenance areas of the facility with GLaDOS trying desperatley to convince you to go back with promise of cake. You eventually come across an office area after a turret battle and become ever more convinced that GLaDOS is the reason you've not met any other humans. You then cross a bridge into her chamber. The hulking machine now resorting to death threats. You then do battle, redirecting rockets through portals and into her body. You then incinerate some important pieces of her until she's destroyed. You're shown a brief glimpse of the outside world before being dragged back into Aperture's walls. The credits roll to "Still Alive" written by Jonathan Coulton. It's a sweet little tune, I'll leave it at that. Go listen to it yourself after beating the game.
NOW LEAVING SPOILER TERRITORY

The game has 15 achievements for you to get in order to claim you've 100% complete the game. To get some you'll have to play through the game's extra modes. Challenge mode puts you back into a few chambers except trying to beat it under one of three conditions: Least Portals, Least Steps, Least Time. Getting every achievement will require some very good knowlege of the game's mechanics and the way the chambers are designed. Good Luck getting the Vanilla Crazy Cake achievement, this requires getting the highest rank for each challenge and for each chamber. The other mode are the Advanced Chambers. You're dropped back into chambers 13-18 except they've been made much harder to complete. To get the Aperture Science achievement you will need to beat all six.

After you've done it all? Well. I'm kind. I shall now list some notable mods and map packs for Portal which you should definately give a look:

MODS:
Very hard logical puzzles: Portal Pro
Bullsh!t flinging puzzles: Portal Prelude
Something Different: Portal Unity
Great Aesthetics and New Mechanics: Blue Portals
Just... More Portal with little in terms of new mechanics: Gamma Energy
Energy Pellets, Just... Energy Pellets: Rexaura
Acid Trip: Hetzchase Nailway

MAP PACKS:
Another.Test.Subject
Portal: The Flash Version Map Pack
Portal: Underground Story
Would recomend it to anyone who likes logical games.

Ce jeu est une vraie bouffée d'oxygène dans le monde vidéoludique.
Vous partez d'un point A et devez créer/utiliser des portails pour arriver à un point B.
Beaucoup de réflexion au menu mais tout se fait sans prise de tête.
Et puis, on peut arrêter et reprendre comme on veut.
Une belle expérience ! Et un grand bravo aux créateurs de l'intelligence artificielle qui nous "accompagne" tout au long du jeu :-)
87/100

Portal has an amazing storyline and simple yet excellent gameplay. The fun that you get from it and the thrill of the storyline together make the game so addictive, like a great page-turning story book. This game had me hooked until the end.

Would DEFINITELY recommend, excellent game, such an amazing original idea, absolutely fantastic story. Must buy 10/10.

Not everything i wanted it to be but its a semi-hard puzzle game that is very playable for its age. Plus it means i got loads of new items for garrys mod to mess around with :)

Es cortito, pero muy interesante la forma de moverse por los portales y la jugabilidad es excelente. 
Las cantidades de cosas que se pueden hacer abriendo solo dos portales es increible al igual que el ingenio de los puzles.. Eso sí debes ser muy logico, pensando podras completar todos los puzzles, de lo contrario con guías y videos se pierde el 100% de la diversion del juego. 
Si no puedes pasar una stage simplemente guardala, sigue mañana verás como todo sale. 
A ver que depara el dos.
muito bom esse jogo do começo ao fim, é muito bem feito e bem divertido de jogar
Muy genial
